title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message:
Hello Everybody

Working on liquid damaged around SMC  820-3437-b. Come with no power problem . After reball SMC power come back and machine power and OS loading ok but now fan problem and slow. 

Reballed 2 times but nothing changed. SMC log at bottom.

Tried also I/O board and trackpad but nothing change where can i check next step?



[I]12/31/15 17:15:10] SMC: 0x0 (test #1) - SMC Critical Sensor Check Test

- Checks if the SMC reports any errors on critical sensors.

[17:15:10] ERROR -- 1 [The SMC reports an error on one or more critical sensors.] -- TEST FAILED

[12/31/15 17:15:10] SMC: 0x0 (test #7) - SMC EPM Flash Check Test

- Check to ensure that UV and CV EPM blocks are programmed.

[17:15:11] Test Passed

[12/31/15 17:15:11] SMC: 0x0 (test #8) - SMC Power Balancing check

- Check to ensure that Power Balancing is enabled.

[17:15:11] Test Passed

- Check to ensure that SMC in App code mode.

[17:15:12] Test Passed

[12/31/15 17:15:12] SMC: 0x0 (test #17) - Sensor Alert TC0P

- This test verifies that the TCOP  hardware alert signals to the SMC

[17:15:14] ERROR - -12016 [Error returned by system function.] -- TEST FAILED

[12/31/15 17:15:14] Current (IC0R) -- Chipset 0 INA Highside (test #1) - Sensor Reads Within Operating Range

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

[12/31/15 17:15:21] Temperature (TB2T) -- Battery Thermal Diode 2 (test #1) - Sensor Reads Within Operating Range

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

[17:15:21] Test Passed

[12/31/15 17:15:21] Temperature (TC0P) -- CPU Proximity (test #1) - Sensor Reads Within Operating Range

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

[COLOR=#FF0000][17:15:24] ERROR -- 1 [Unable to read sensor] -- TEST FAILED[/COLOR]

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

[17:15:24] Test Passed

- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.

[COLOR=#FF0000][17:15:25] ERROR -- 1 [Unable to read sensor] -- TEST FAILED[/COLOR]

[12/31/15 17:15:25] Temperature (Th1H) -- Fin Stack (test #1) - Sensor Reads Within Operating Range


[12/31/15 17:15:28] Temperature (TC0P) -- CPU Proximity (test #11) - Extended Sensor Flat Line Test

- Checks that the Sensor changes value i.e. not stuck, with longer time allowance for change (5 mins).

[COLOR=#FF0000][17:15:28] ERROR - -13005 [The SMC can not read this sensor] -- TEST FAILED[/COLOR]

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: Check pull up resistors R5360-R5361 and voltage on pin 2 from both resistors, also check for corrosion on J4002, U5800 and U5620, if everything is fine i would say SMC is bad....

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: Problem on SMBUS_SMC_1, could be any device on this bus. iSight connector is suspect.

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message:
Thanks for answer Duke and aprendiz,
Yes you are right when checked SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL line voltage is drop 0.6V ( must be 3.4 v ) Checked R5361 fine also replaced.
When checked line not short a ground ( checking voltage when board is pulled out with out lcd keyboard etc. , when machine turn power on SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL voltage is ok 3.4 v but mouse light is turned on , so machine started. voltage is pull down 0.6v ) Checked line witch component connected every thing is looking good.

Last step cut SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL line to SMC connection voltage is normal 3.4V .

Also replaced SMC same issue :(

I cant understand why SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL voltage is pulling down when connected SMC.

note: Sorry for bad english.... I hope described correctly.

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: I bet it is the iSight connector, disconnect it (j4002)

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: Looked like clean J4002 connector but also removed after your suggestion, nothing changed :(

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: What is diode mode on both SMBUS_SMC_1 lines? SCL and SDA?

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: Red proble at ground 405 shows both side. I have known good board measure it 395 shows i think its not important difference.

title: 820-3437-B Thermal sensor problem
message: Red proble at ground 405 shows both side. I have known good board measure it 395 shows i think its not important difference.
